Title: Multiple food applications (ASO, SCRD, ORCA and OFP) were unavailable
Action:
The service flow was not properly appreciated prior to the change and also there is no lower environment.

Foods env operates under Active Active  in lower environment there is only one region.
Action updates:
Incident caused by change.

Objective of change: 

The current Azure Hub and Spoke design allows traffic to transit through virtual network gateways via Express Route, however this introduces a risk of lateral movement between portfolios. 

As part of security strategy, this change was deployed to add routes in the production foods route tables thus allowing all the traffic to go via either the azure firewall or PA firewall based in the flow. It will reduce the attacks and vulnerability issues. 

Change & Recovery update: 
The change started at 05:35, and it was implemented as per plan and completed at 07:00. After the work, alerting highlighted that a few areas had connectivity issues (MQ and ES API calls failing). 

It was found that the inter region connectivity failed. As work around a change was made in the firewall policy to allow the traffic through the azure firewall but the issue persisted. It was then decided to revert the change to restore service.

Title: Store tills offline while processing refunds.
Action: What caused the IIS server to go into error state?
Action updates:
The tills were showing offline as one of the POS IIS servers (Internet Information service  an extensible webserver software for the Windows server) had stopped running due to a memory constraint. This was caused due to the simultaneous execution of the Defender updates at 03:07 on the impacted server and the daily TSM (Tivoli Store Manager) system backup at 03:00.

Please note, the defender update is a usual event and is executed at different times in all the 3 POS servers. It has been ascertained that the Defender had huge signature files which ran in parallel with the TSM backup which significantly contributed to the memory issue. Actions have been agreed uplift the memory and the virtual memory configurations

Action: Perform the memory uplift and review the virtual memory configurations.

Title: Customers getting errors while tracking orders
Action: Do we need to review the time zone in Salesforce and set to BST?
Action updates:
Raise case with Sales force to set time zone to BST and follow up.
7-Jul - Raised the Salesforce ticket: Case #44913543 for time zone difference in Salesforce Data extension.
Update from Salesforce that time different of around 7 hours when storing data into data extension (which are used in a journey). Please note that the time difference of 7 hours accounts for the CST Time Zone. If you subtract 7 hours from the timestamp value, it would then equate CST time.
Unfortunately, this is by design and there are no standard feature of changing this behaviour. Having said that, you can can look to convert the value into a desired time zone.

Action updates: Analysis output from EM team - The SMS requests from returns were missing <tns:SMS> segment in the source xml. Title: Customers cannot place orders via desktop, mobile , apps

Title: Customers cannot place orders via desktop, mobile , apps
Action:
Software systems are inherently complex, and any change has the potential 
for unexpected harm to be done. Any change to production should be sanity 
tested, preferably via automation. In this incident, if the PIM change had been 
sanity tested, the link between the change and the incident could have been 
made sooner
Action updates: 15/08: Reviewed with Akamai around the option to test any production changes in Staging environment before activation for end customers. This process will be followed for any future changes. Agreed all production changes in Akamai will be carried out as part of the CR process.

Title: B2B customers unable to use their e-codes/e-gift cards
Action: Progress root cause investigation with Scene 7. Need to have a technical with Scene 7.
Action updates:
The B2B e-gift cards involves Akamai Dynamic Media delivery at Customer pointing to the Adobe managed CDN (Content Delivery Network). When the CDN has the content in cache, it is served from the CDN cache, otherwise, the CDN will fetch the content from one of its origin servers. Th origin servers are located in different datacentres - Amsterdam, London and Ireland. The Ireland datacentre was built recently and some validation steps were missed at Adobe causing http traffic not being enabled resulting in thtermittent 500 internal server errors.

Root cause : Vendor Scene 7 confirmed that the B2B e-gift card URL using HTTP was not enabled in the recently built Adobe datacentre due to insufficient testing resulting in the 500 internal server errors.

Title: Time and Attendance application was inaccessible via desktop
Action: Root cause of the issue
Action updates: The database query responsible for user authentication had picked up an inefficient execution plan due to a huge volume of data in the database, causing the issue. The Blue Yonder purge job responsible for the database housekeeping did not run from 31/03 due to a conflict with the schedule restart of the APE engine resulting in the huge data volume.

Title: Time and Attendance application was inaccessible via desktop

Action updates: The flush job is scheduled to run every 4 hours and there is no scope of manual amendments

Title: Time and Attendance application was inaccessible via desktop

Title: Time and Attendance application was inaccessible via desktop
Action: The purge job had not executed from 31st March 2023, why was this not identified at BY?
Action updates: The APE schedule restart runs at 05:00 initially, it was preponed to 00:00 by a change on 31/03 which caused a conflict with the purge job (running default at 00:00). This was not identified due to inefficient testing and post implementation checks. In addition, there was no alerting for the purge job in the BY environment.

Title: Dropship order confirmation messages failing in Sterling
Action: Root cause from Commerce Hub.
Action updates:
Completed. Root cause provided by CommerceHub is as below:
What happened?
The internal project structure for the validation engine was overhauled and included in another project and has been for many months. An unrelated change was implemented in a different branch of the new project structure that had an unexpected impact on the validation engine.

Why was Customer impacted?
The change specifically impacted validation on the field items.retailerItemIds for which Marks and Spencer have a custom validation rule set up.

How was it fixed?
The conflicting branches have now been combined into a single branch with all previous fixes from both branches restored.

Title: Performance issue with Customer application in BP stores

Action updates: The SCEP updates are scheduled in batches anytime between 22:30 and 04:00 based on the number of stores planned. On 25/04, the first batch of the package distribution was randomly scheduled to run at 02:30 due to low volume of planned stores, hence the deployment was extended for BP stores due to insufficient network bandwidth between Hughes and BP

Title: Performance issue with Customer application in BP stores
Action: What is the usual schedule for these Scep updates?
Action updates: These SCEP updates are usually deployed in batches every week across the 1000 stores in the estate. However, the last patch update was deployed in March which did not cause any issues. In March, due to the higher number of stores, the first batch ran at 12:00, however, in April, it was scheduled at 02:30 due to lower volume of stores, therefore, action has been agreed to ascertain a particular time window suitable for these deployment across the BP stores without impacting their operations

Title: WMS application unavailable at Castle Donington and Ollerton DCs
Action: Root cause behind the primary database server in the SP cluster going to an unreachable state?
Action updates:
Severity 1 cases have been raised with vendors HP and Redhat for further triage. 
Vendor HP advised that 3 out of 4 storage switches were offline, which were then replaced. 
Also, HP identified issues with the SFP in one of the ports on the storage switches, which was then replaced to bring up the storage switches. 
As the primary server continue to be unstable, the SFP in one of the ports on the server was replaced, after which the server came online.

Title: COSTA purchase order interface was unavailable

Action updates: After the completion of the regular pre-requisite activities, it was identified that some unknown/ghost transactions were still getting posted in the system every 15 mins, although there were no activities performed. The clearance of these transactions took longer which contributed to an hour extension of the SAP release. There are no logs/evidence identified to understand the source of these transactions, however, tech teams are in process of replicating the issue in the non-prod environment

If required, testing needs to be performed again before implementing it in the Customer landscape.

Title: COSTA purchase order interface was unavailable

Title: COSTA purchase order interface was unavailable
Action: What is the cause behind the invalid characters in the SAP deployment package? Was it identified during testing?
Action updates: There were no issues observed in the testing phase. Due to an interim change made in the SAP cloud solution (by SAP Vendor) to exclude non-ASCII characters in the deployment package description, after the testing completed in the Customer environment. As the release package deployed in the Customer environment had a non-ASCII character, it caused the issue.

Action: Review the change deployment process in middleware system to ensure that peer review process is adhered.
Action updates: 25/04: Agreed on the call that the peer review process will be adhered to, and this will be re-educated to the team.

Title: Foods final orders were duplicated for 60 suppliers
Action: Review the rationale of the CICD deployment process to see if this remain the most suitable method
Action updates:
16/05:For MQFTE monitor based deployments(affected pattern in this case), CICD currently has the feature to do only the incremental deployments(by comparing the production code base with the new changes and deploy the delta changes alone for all the applicable consumers) instead of deploying the whole interface.
In the failure scenario, since the incorrect code base was taken for CXM, CICD treated this a change(expected) and hence CXM consumer was also considered for deployment along with DS consumer.
In order to avoid these deployment issues caused to inadvertent changes as part of the change requirement , we are planning to create a ansible report feature which will give a snapshot of all the impacted components that will be deployed during the execution. The same report will be reviewed for any inadvertent changes before we sign off the change.(Same process already in place for ACE/IIB Integration)
Analysis/design in progress to add this feature and will aim to deploy this change in CI/CD by end of this quarter and it being tracked under the back log id 
05/05: Team is assessing the feasibility for alternative options of deployment in the CI CD framework

Title: CSSM did not receive the store information for 378 stores

A risk 1834 has been raised to address this

Title: CSSM did not receive the store information for 378 stores
Action: Root cause behind the partial file generation in CLCAS.
Action updates: The CLCAS job responsible for generating the store location file failed on 21/04 due to a file contention, as the file was picked up by the MQFTE file transfer job which runs every 1 min as per design. This resulted in the generation of the partial file which was then picked up by the Datastage job on 22/04 and thereby sent it to CSSM, causing the issue.

Title: CSSM did not receive the store information for 378 stores
Action: Feasibility to fine tune the MQFTE transfer job configuration.
Action updates: It has been agreed to amend the MQFTE transfer job run from 1 min to 2 mins. In addition, the job will only transfer the file to DS when there is no change in the file size for two consecutive runs. Implemented under CRQ#175445

Title: CSSM did not receive the store information for 378 stores
Action: Validations to be performed in the datastage layer before processing the store location files from CLCAS via MQFTE.
Action updates: Additional validations and alerting have been configured to validate store allocation file based of the file structure before processing them in datastage.

Title: CSSM did not receive the store information for 378 stores
Action: CLCAS had sent the complete store file after the partial file was sent to DS, why was the complete file not picked up by Datastage? A SOP will be created detailing the steps to recover such issues in future
Action updates:
It has been confirmed that CLCAS had sent the complete store location file at 21:30, 21/04, however, it was a miss from Datastage to process the correct file into CSSM. This has been addressed and an additional validation will be performed for both 17:30 and 22:00 DS job runs to avoid this issue in future. See action #3.

SOP created and validated

Title: Connectivity issue between cloud applications and SAP
Action: Is resilience in place during such global issues?
Action updates:
13/04: Availability zones (AZ) are single failure domains within a single geographical region and are separate physical locations with independent power, network, and cooling. Multiple AZs exist in one region and are connected with each other through a low-latency network.  SAP BTP services run on this Multi-AZ concept of the underlying hyperscalers thereby offering High Availability. Hence, if there is an outage in one of the AZs, the service/application will self-heal and will continue to be serviced with the other AZs in the region.
11/04:  SAP product team is awaiting for  a slot with vendor SAP to discuss
03/04: A call is being with Product teams to discuss further on the resileince 
27/03: Awaiting further updates.

Title: Stores unable to perform waste reduction
Action: What caused the table indexing and data sync issue in the RI DB? What was the fix implemented?
Action updates:
07/03: The nightly database maintenance indexing and maintenance job  at RI had been failing for a few days. After the failure was identified, RI reran the job at 10:30 and at approximately 11am the indexing job started working on the very large table used by the markdown solution. Title: Intermittent performance issues in SAP after SAP upgrade
Action: Ben Dewitt has agreed that no further actions are required as ECC is now end of life and will be replaced with S4 Hana which will be deployed after business cases have been approved.  This system will be entirely new and as such the learnings from a SAP ECC release are redundant.
Action updates:
How can we make sure that Upgrade outage duration is estimated better (if possible)?
Comment:  Based on the earlier exp of the upgrade we assumed that a 1-hour buffer would suffice as it would be faster in the production environment. Production has more capacity in terms of CPU and memory and we have already added additional parallel jobs compared to Pre-prod environment.
Action: 1 hour buffer is not sufficient for an activity with this complexity, and additional contingency will be added for future significant SAP outages. COMPLETE
Could the DB performance issue have been picked up in testing?
Comment: since no further upgrades will be done in SAP ECC, the SAP S/HANA (new product, cloud based) will have new processes for automated testing and outage management. 
Action: None. COMPLETE

For the 640K missing sales (caused by upgrade defect), could this have been picked up in testing?
Comment:  21K sales messages were stuck in PO due  upgrade defect around 3 decimals issue; issue rapidly fixed and data reprocessed by Sunday for SAP and EDW. Test Coverage: Team has tested a scenario with 2 digits and it was rounded off successfully through SAP PO successfully and scenarios were passed. However, the issue happens when more than 2 decimal digits are flown in for WH_SMITH through A9 interface and thus the issue wasnt identified. Subset of scenario with more than 2 digits wasnt covered due to risk based test approach.
Action:  To prevent this, a new scenario is added in Core Regression suite for considering more than two digits in amount field of A9 and WH_SMITH interfaces while posting in SAP PO. COMPLETE

For the 15% late GMOR sales, how could this have been avoided during Batch Catchup after outage?
Action: confirmed with Sales and BW teams that after an outage the GMOR sales jobs should only be started once all inbound sales transactsions have been processed; it is better for the reporting data to be late than incomplete. COMPLETE

Title: Intermittent performance issues in SAP after SAP upgrade
Action: SAP teams to provide a full statement of the events with descriptions of each factor that led to the delay
Action updates:
The Agreed outage was extended by two hours due to several reasons:
BW queue clearing prerequisite(1 hour): delayed since messages kept flowing into queue whilst BW team were clearing the previous messages
Action: Ensure inbound jobs are stopped and the messages in PO are all drained before commencing the BW queue clearance to avoid delays due to trickling in of additional messages. Queue Clearing Process agreed with team. COMPLETE
During version upgrade in production, the SLT triggers had to be dropped and tables regenerated in new EHP8. This consumed additional efforts eating into the buffer time (1 hour). Couldn't plan this as it didn't happen during non-prod upgrades(shadow).
Comment: As part of the upgrade process, as it's a live system upgrade process continuously try to create the triggers on the tables. As part of the pre-process activities, we have moved around 16K tables to the new tablespace to avoid the issue as we performed the same in our PT (DR system). But during the Downtime phase, it created more tables and created issues. For this, we had to move around 600 tables temporarily to the new tablespace created. After moving the tables to new tablespaces issue didn't occur.
Action: For this version upgrade we already started the pre-req and pre-upgrade process very early. As Prod is a live system this impacted on the upgrade execution. In the future maybe we need to start the activities based on the PT runtime with an addition of 4 days to avoid delays and not impact on a production system. COMPLETE

Action updates: A new relic alert was triggered at 17:09 and the issue was addressed on time. There are separate alerts for other counts performed across the estate. No additional alerts required

Title: Issues in performing counting for F19a Grocery and F20a Wine stock at stores
Action: In Nov 2022 as part of the Count app release the SDK was also upgraded from 23 to 26.  Were we aware of the bug during the deployment?  If yes, why did we proceed? If not, then was the correct level of testing done to identify such bugs - if not how can we carry out testing that reflects production load - giving us the best chance of finding any issues?
Action updates: The non-prod test case did not involve this target sdk configuration change. Tech will now include this test case in their deployment SOP to address this issue in future

Title: Issues in performing counting for F19a Grocery and F20a Wine stock at stores
Action: What was the root cause of the issue?
Action updates:
A bug in the target SDK version 26 (software development kit used to build applications in Android) in CSSM count app released in the Nov 2022 had caused the issue. As per Android developer document, if the target Sdk Version >= 24 and the saved state goes beyond a certain size, it will cause a runtime exception crash. The volume of counts performed across F15a and F20a products were significantly higher on 08/01, thus causing the issue. 
Note: These departments were last counted on July 2022 when the sdk version was 23, hence no issues were reported

Title: Retail dashboard sales flow was delayed
Action: Was there an alert for the Surrogate key threshold? Was the surrogate key threshold gradual or sudden? Were we aware of reaching the limit before 30/11? Feasibility of creating an alert to identify the surrogate key is nearing its threshold?
Action updates:
30/12: Deployment completed yesterday, closing the action
29/12: Got approval to implement on 29th due to long Christmas weekend, waiting for confirmation to close the action
22/12: Deployment is rescheduled to 28th Dec. Due to long weekend and peak we are preferring for any changes to be done post this long weekend only.
15/12: We have identified the solution for this alert check and expecting to deploy the same by 23rd Dec. It is for the impacted tables we had on that day.
09/12: No alert was there for Surrogate key threshold. Surrogate key threshold was gradual as transactions are flowing into this table from last 10 years. We were not aware of reching the limit before 30/11. We are checking the feasibility of creating an alert to identify the surrogate key when it is nearing its threshold.
07/12: There were no alerts configured previously for this threshold, as this is the first occurrence of the issue. The threshold reached its limit gradually. The feasibility of creating an alert are being explored.

Title: Delay to the GMOR critical batches
Action: What caused the selective deletion to not work causing the predecessor step to overrun on 16/10. Fix the resolve this problem. Can we configure an alert?
Action updates:
19/10: Team identified that on certain weeks, the selective deletion program has not deleted the expected data with successful completion of the program leading with no alerts. The program has not deleted data as expected since the Stock reporting table has been locked in a parallel load to a different table. Whenever such locks are in the table, deletion cannot happen. But the Program is currently designed in such a way that the program completes for such locks without deleting the data.

Workaround:
As a workaround, we would re-design the job in Production to allow the Selective deletion program to run on an ideal window and make the parallel loading step to be in sequence to the deletion program. By doing so, the locking issue can be eradicated.

Fix:
As a permanent fix, we will re-design the program in order to throw an error whenever lock occurs to the table and causing deletion not to occur. Backlog ID SAP-GMORBW-00051 has been created for the same.

Title: Issue with DTC services on Infoblox
Action: Why did the change in non-prod impact production service?
Action updates:
20/10:Due to the bug in current NIOS version 8.5.4, its impacted the production also while run the script in Non Prod. This is addressed and fixed in NIOS 9.0. and the Infoblox upgrade will be planned after peak and this will tracked under the risk 1780 
Below is technical RCA shared by Infoblox
The reason for this behavior is as in the words of engineering team, When named_control sends SIGTERM to the named process while doing forceful restart then the idns threads will not exit immediately, when they are actively receiving the health updates. The threads which are not exiting wont return immediately until the timeout is expired or there is no more data to be received from the other end. Hence we need to forcefully exit the receiving sockets before another thread join / instantiation. 
28/09: A case has been raised with Infoblox to understand why it impacted production services. Network is following up with Infoblox to understand the RC. Infoblox has advised that the similar issue has been observed for the customers and they are continuing to investigate 

Network team to chase up with Infoblox for the RCA.

Title: Spike in offline and failed card transactions for stores
Action: Awaiting RCA from worldline
Action updates: On 15th September 2022 Worldline's Advanced Infrastructure Services (AIS) deployed an automated change applied to the ahub.global.ingenico.com DNS record. AHUB is a shared service so this resulted in failures of payment platforms depending on it (including the AXIS platform for customers that rely on AHUB(authorization flow). The change was erroneously executed not in "test" mode but in execute, effectively creating a new DNS subzone for each tenant that held the name of the tenant(ahub.global.ingenico.com). As the tenant already had an Address record pointing to the same name (ahub.global.ingenico.com). The new subzone effectively masked the visibility of the original Address record.
